mitre_attack_techniques.signature_description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.
Creates a DirectInput object (often for capturing keystrokes)

signature_matches.name: terminate process
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: terminate process
    namespace: host-interaction/process/terminate
    authors:
      - moritz.raabe@mandiant.com
      - mehunhoff@google.com
      - anushka.virgaonkar@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function
      dynamic: span of calls
    mbc:
      - Process::Terminate Process [C0018]
    examples:
      - C91887D861D9BD4A5872249B641BC9F9:0x401A77
      - 9B7CCAA2AE6A5B96E3110EBCBC4311F6:0x10010307
  features:
    - or:
      - api: System.Diagnostics.Process::Kill
      - api: System.Diagnostics.Process::WaitForExit
      - api: System.Diagnostics.Process::WaitForExitAsync
      - api: System.Environment::Exit
      - api: System.Windows.Forms.Application::Exit
      - api: exit
      - api: Exit
      - api: RstrtMgr.RmShutdown
      - and:
        - os: linux
        - api: exit_group
      - and:
        - optional:
          - match: open process
        - or:
          - api: kernel32.TerminateProcess
          - api: ntdll.NtTerminateProcess
          - api: kernel32.ExitProcess
          - api: ZwTerminateProcess

signature_matches.name: contains PDB path
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: contains PDB path
    namespace: executable/pe/pdb
    authors:
      - moritz.raabe@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: file
      dynamic: file
    examples:
      - 464EF2CA59782CE697BC329713698CCC  # level32.exe
  features:
    - string: /:\\.*\.pdb/

signature_matches.name: accept command line arguments
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: accept command line arguments
    namespace: host-interaction/cli
    authors:
      - moritz.raabe@mandiant.com
      - anushka.virgaonkar@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function
      dynamic: call
    att&ck:
      - Execution::Command and Scripting Interpreter [T1059]
    mbc:
      - Execution::Command and Scripting Interpreter [E1059]
    examples:
      - e5369ac309f1be6d77afeeb3edab0ed8:0x402760
  features:
    - or:
      - api: GetCommandLine
      - api: CommandLineToArgv
      - api: System.Environment::GetCommandLineArgs

signature_matches.description: Creates a DirectInput object (often for capturing keystrokes)
PE file has an executable .text section and no other executable section
Sample tries to load a library which is not present or installed on the analysis machine, adding the library might reveal more behavior
Contains modern PE file flags such as dynamic base (ASLR) or NX
Program does not show much activity (idle)
PE / OLE file has a valid certificate
Binary contains paths to debug symbols

match_data: Process Memory Space: client32.exe PID: 4220, type: MEMORYSTR

signature_matches.description: PE file contains a debug data directory
URLs found in memory or binary data

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Remote Access Tool - NetSupport Execution From Unusual Location
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of client32.exe (NetSupport RAT) from an unusual location (outside of 'C:\Program Files')

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Remote Access Tool - NetSupport Execution From Unusual Location
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of client32.exe (NetSupport RAT) from an unusual location (outside of 'C:\Program Files')

An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

T1071.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.

T1056.description: Creates a DirectInput object (often for capturing keystrokes)
